thread.title: Roundup (Oct. 17): Bulls football beats Western Tech, 40-24
thread.title_full: Roundup (Oct. 17): Bulls football beats Western Tech, 40-24

author: Nelson Coffin
title: Roundup (Oct. 17): Bulls football beats Western Tech, 40-24
text:
var ssaUrl = ('https:' == document.location.protocol ? 'https://' : 'http://') + 'pixel.sitescout.com/iap/0ea84626951144d2';new Image().src = ssaUrl;"/> Sports Roundup (Oct. 17): Bulls football beats Western Tech, 40-24 Hereford vs. Western Tech football photo by Steve Ruark 
Hereford's Tom Bartenfelder, right, intercepts a pass intended for Western Tech's Aina Akbar during the Bulls' 40-24 victory Saturday. 

Hereford's Tom Bartenfelder, right, intercepts a pass intended for Western Tech's Aina Akbar during the Bulls' 40-24 victory Saturday. 
(photo by Steve Ruark) Nelson Coffin Baltimore Sun Media Group 
Both the Hereford and Western Tech football teams were in a giving mood Saturday afternoon on a wind-swept field at Lansdowne, combining for seven turnovers in a battle between upper-tier Baltimore County teams. 
And while the Bulls (5-2) had the most miscues, three first-half fumbles by the Wolverines (5-2) were ultimately their downfall in a 40-24 defeat. 
Hereford was the more generous of the rivals early on, fumbling the opening kickoff, which Western Tech senior Kareem Cromwell recovered. 
Two plays later, quarterback Harry Shamar found fellow senior Michael O'Neill open down the middle of the field for a 25-yard touchdown pass and a 6-0 advantage. 
The lead ballooned to 12-0 after Shamar scrambled for 70 yards and another score. 
The teams then traded touchdowns — a 1-yard plunge by Zach Jacobs for the Bulls and a 37-yard pass from Shamar to junior Georon Bowens — to maintain Hereford's 12-point deficit.
